channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SGDA: Towards 3D Universal Pulmonary Nodule Detection via Slice Grouped Domain Attention
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a slice grouped domain attention (SGDA) module to enhance the generalization capability of the pulmonary nodule detection networks.

item.title: Zeroth-Order Optimization Meets Human Feedback: Provable Learning via Ranking Oracles
item.description: In this paper, we focus on a novel optimization problem in which the objective function is a black-box and can only be evaluated through a ranking oracle.

item.title: Face: Fast, Accurate and Context-Aware Audio Annotation and Classification
item.description: This paper presents a context-aware framework for feature selection and classification procedures to realize a fast and accurate audio event annotation and classification.

item.title: Learning Hamiltonian Systems with Mono-Implicit Runge-Kutta Methods
item.description: Numerical integrators could be used to form interpolation conditions when training neural networks to approximate the vector field of an ordinary differential equation (ODE) from data.

item.title: Learning multi-scale local conditional probability models of images
item.description: We instantiate this model using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) with local receptive fields, which enforce both the stationarity and Markov properties.

item.title: CLIP-guided Prototype Modulating for Few-shot Action Recognition
item.description: Learning from large-scale contrastive language-image pre-training like CLIP has shown remarkable success in a wide range of downstream tasks recently, but it is still under-explored on the challenging few-shot action recognition (FSAR) task.

item.title: Non-Parametric Outlier Synthesis
item.description: Importantly, our proposed synthesis approach does not make any distributional assumption on the ID embeddings, thereby offering strong flexibility and generality.

item.title: Guiding Energy-based Models via Contrastive Latent Variables
item.description: To enable the joint training of EBM and CRL, we also design a new class of latent-variable EBMs for learning the joint density of data and the contrastive latent variable.

item.title: HiCLIP: Contrastive Language-Image Pretraining with Hierarchy-aware Attention
item.description: The success of large-scale contrastive vision-language pretraining (CLIP) has benefited both visual recognition and multimodal content understanding.

item.title: Structured Kernel Estimation for Photon-Limited Deconvolution
item.description: By modeling the blur kernel using a low-dimensional representation with the key points on the motion trajectory, we significantly reduce the search space and improve the regularity of the kernel estimation problem.

item.title: Dual Feedback Attention Framework via Boundary-Aware Auxiliary and Progressive Semantic Optimization for Salient Object Detection in Optical Remote Sensing Imagery
item.description: In addition, existing methods do not pay sufficient attention to the boundary of the object, and the completeness of the final saliency map still needs improvement.

item.title: Centroid Distance Distillation for Effective Rehearsal in Continual Learning
item.description: Rehearsal, retraining on a stored small data subset of old tasks, has been proven effective in solving catastrophic forgetting in continual learning.

item.title: DeCap: Decoding CLIP Latents for Zero-Shot Captioning via Text-Only Training
item.description: This decoder is both data-efficient and computation-efficient: 1) it only requires the text data for training, easing the burden on the collection of paired data.

item.title: MoveFormer: a Transformer-based model for step-selection animal movement modelling
item.description: In this work, we propose MoveFormer, a new step-based model of movement capable of learning directly from full animal trajectories.

item.title: A Unified Algebraic Perspective on Lipschitz Neural Networks
item.description: Important research efforts have focused on the design and training of neural networks with a controlled Lipschitz constant.

item.title: Referring Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new and general referring understanding task, termed referring multi-object tracking (RMOT).

item.title: CRIN: Rotation-Invariant Point Cloud Analysis and Rotation Estimation via Centrifugal Reference Frame
item.description: CRIN directly takes the coordinates of points as input and transforms local points into rotation-invariant representations via centrifugal reference frames.

item.title: SUREL+: Moving from Walks to Sets for Scalable Subgraph-based Graph Representation Learning
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel framework SUREL+ that upgrades SUREL by using node sets instead of walks to represent subgraphs.

item.title: Rethinking Confidence Calibration for Failure Prediction
item.description: We investigate this problem and reveal that popular confidence calibration methods often lead to worse confidence separation between correct and incorrect samples, making it more difficult to decide whether to trust a prediction or not.

item.title: SC-Block: Supervised Contrastive Blocking within Entity Resolution Pipelines
item.description: To reduce these runtimes, entity resolution pipelines are constructed of two parts: a blocker that applies a computationally cheap method to select candidate record pairs, and a matcher that afterwards identifies matching pairs from this set using more expensive methods.

item.title: KBNet: Kernel Basis Network for Image Restoration
item.description: In this paper, we propose a kernel basis attention (KBA) module, which introduces learnable kernel bases to model representative image patterns for spatial information aggregation.

item.title: Symbolic Synthesis of Neural Networks
item.description: Neural networks adapt very well to distributed and continuous representations, but struggle to learn and generalize from small amounts of data.

item.title: Exploring Deep Models for Practical Gait Recognition
item.description: This paper presents a unified perspective to explore how to construct deep models for state-of-the-art outdoor gait recognition, including the classical CNN-based and emerging Transformer-based architectures.

item.title: Boosting Differentiable Causal Discovery via Adaptive Sample Reweighting
item.description: Despite great success in low-dimensional linear systems, it has been observed that these approaches overly exploit easier-to-fit samples, thus inevitably learning spurious edges.

item.title: Enhancing Activity Prediction Models in Drug Discovery with the Ability to Understand Human Language
item.description: Activity and property prediction models are the central workhorses in drug discovery and materials sciences, but currently they have to be trained or fine-tuned for new tasks.

item.title: Searching for Effective Neural Network Architectures for Heart Murmur Detection from Phonocardiogram
item.description: Aim: The George B. Moody PhysioNet Challenge 2022 raised problems of heart murmur detection and related abnormal cardiac function identification from phonocardiograms (PCGs).

item.title: Towards Zero-Shot Functional Compositionality of Language Models
item.description: Large Pre-trained Language Models (PLM) have become the most desirable starting point in the field of NLP, as they have become remarkably good at solving many individual tasks.

item.title: A System for Generalized 3D Multi-Object Search
item.description: GenMOS takes as input point cloud observations of the local region, object detection results, and localization of the robot's view pose, and outputs a 6D viewpoint to move to through online planning.

item.title: Faithfulness-Aware Decoding Strategies for Abstractive Summarization
item.description: We present a systematic study of the effect of generation techniques such as beam search and nucleus sampling on faithfulness in abstractive summarization.

item.title: OpenICL: An Open-Source Framework for In-context Learning
item.description: However, the implementation of ICL is sophisticated due to the diverse retrieval and inference methods involved, as well as the varying pre-processing requirements for different models, datasets, and tasks.

item.title: Faster Learning of Temporal Action Proposal via Sparse Multilevel Boundary Generator
item.description: Temporal action localization in videos presents significant challenges in the field of computer vision.

item.title: Neighborhood Contrastive Transformer for Change Captioning
item.description: Change captioning is to describe the semantic change between a pair of similar images in natural language.

item.title: Visual Place Recognition: A Tutorial
item.description: It unifies the terminology of VPR and complements prior research in two important directions: 1) It provides a systematic introduction for newcomers to the field, covering topics such as the formulation of the VPR problem, a general-purpose algorithmic pipeline, an evaluation methodology for VPR approaches, and the major challenges for VPR and how they may be addressed.

item.title: A Multi-Grained Self-Interpretable Symbolic-Neural Model For Single/Multi-Labeled Text Classification
item.description: As the structured language model learns to predict constituency trees in a self-supervised manner, only raw texts and sentence-level labels are required as training data, which makes it essentially a general constituent-level self-interpretable classification model.

item.title: MABNet: Master Assistant Buddy Network with Hybrid Learning for Image Retrieval
item.description: We present a novel Master Assistant Buddy Network (MABNet) for image retrieval which incorporates both learning mechanisms.

item.title: Multimodal Prompting with Missing Modalities for Visual Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we tackle two challenges in multimodal learning for visual recognition: 1) when missing-modality occurs either during training or testing in real-world situations; and 2) when the computation resources are not available to finetune on heavy transformer models.

item.title: MotionVideoGAN: A Novel Video Generator Based on the Motion Space Learned from Image Pairs
item.description: We present MotionVideoGAN, a novel video generator synthesizing videos based on the motion space learned by pre-trained image pair generators.

item.title: SynthASpoof: Developing Face Presentation Attack Detection Based on Privacy-friendly Synthetic Data
item.description: To target these legal and technical challenges, this work presents the first synthetic-based face PAD dataset, named SynthASpoof, as a large-scale PAD development dataset.

item.title: On the universal distribution of the coverage in split conformal prediction
item.description: Two additional universal properties are established in the split conformal prediction framework.

item.title: Event-based Camera Simulation using Monte Carlo Path Tracing with Adaptive Denoising
item.description: This paper proposes an algorithm for obtaining an event-based video from a noisy input video given by physics-based Monte Carlo path tracing of synthetic 3D scenes.

item.title: Iterative Approximate Cross-Validation
item.description: Cross-validation (CV) is one of the most popular tools for assessing and selecting predictive models.

item.title: Streaming Active Learning with Deep Neural Networks
item.description: Active learning is perhaps most naturally posed as an online learning problem.

item.title: Robust affine feature matching via quadratic assignment on Grassmannians
item.description: The algorithm is based on the Grassmannian of $k$--dimensional planes in $\mathbb{R}^n$ and minimizing the Frobenius norm between the two elements of the Grassmannian.

item.title: Maximizing Spatio-Temporal Entropy of Deep 3D CNNs for Efficient Video Recognition
item.description: In this work, we propose to automatically design efficient 3D CNN architectures via a novel training-free neural architecture search approach tailored for 3D CNNs considering the model complexity.

item.title: Heterogeneous Graph Learning for Acoustic Event Classification
item.description: Heterogeneous graphs provide a compact, efficient, and scalable way to model data involving multiple disparate modalities.

item.title: A Formal Metareasoning Model of Concurrent Planning and Execution
item.description: When timing is tight, there may be insufficient time to complete the search for a plan before it is time to act.

item.title: Super-Resolution Neural Operator
item.description: We propose Super-resolution Neural Operator (SRNO), a deep operator learning framework that can resolve high-resolution (HR) images at arbitrary scales from the low-resolution (LR) counterparts.

item.title: Swim: A General-Purpose, High-Performing, and Efficient Activation Function for Locomotion Control Tasks
item.description: We then conclude that Swim is a state-of-the-art activation function for continuous control locomotion tasks and recommend using it with TD3 as a working framework.

item.title: Expectation consistency for calibration of neural networks
item.description: Despite their incredible performance, it is well reported that deep neural networks tend to be overoptimistic about their prediction confidence.

item.title: VTQA: Visual Text Question Answering via Entity Alignment and Cross-Media Reasoning
item.description: The ideal form of Visual Question Answering requires understanding, grounding and reasoning in the joint space of vision and language and serves as a proxy for the AI task of scene understanding.
